intro: Tinnea rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodesian tinnea, is a small shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Tinnea rhodesiana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, arid conditions.
